instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Has anyone replaced the USB-C connectors on this board or any of the non-Touch Bar 2016/2017 Pros? I have one with a crater in it, and a bad short so I have to pull it off, and hopefully replace it. Any tips?

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Never done that, would need a donor or maybe the connector is the same as the ones on the separate boards. Probably will take a lot of heat as I imagine the board will be pretty beefy around those ports. If one of the ports is working I would recommend just living with the burned one and capping it off.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Ok, thanks. It's got a shorted crater so I have to at least remove the one bad one. I'll try pulling it off and see what happens.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Just saw the piece off with the short if the short is in the protruding piece of the connector.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Done, thanks. Came off really clean with wire cutter. Short is gone on DC-in line. Has short on PPBUS still. I'll track that down and see where I'm at after eliminating that.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Hmmm, if this was no liquid it may very well have been lightning then or a really shitty chinese charger.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: No, this one was liquid-damaged. I've posted a lot of boards lately, you might be thinking of a different one.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: Nevermind, another crater right near the PPBUS fuse. Dead short, can't dig it out. I have a new, very expensive 2017 donor board.

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message: did u actually replace the usb connectors? i have one liquid damaged board 820-00840, the board seems clean, but the usb connectors are rusted away, it actaully takes 20V 0.02A measured with usb-c meter, there is loads of BGA around , how can i safely replace the connectors?

threads.title: 820-00840 Blown up USB-C.
threads.message:
Please open new thread with your problem.

I recommend you to use Quik Chip alloy to remove damaged connector.
58 degrees version should be the best for that.
Be aware, clean all the solder very good, before resolder new connector!!!
